parameters: A single Minotaur stands at the gate, sword ready.
You see others inside the town turn to watch.
You ready your sword for a bloody battle.
You've acquired the key fragments. Return to the Mayor.
You arrive at the Minotaurs' home camp.
A feminine Minotaur stands at the front gate, watching you.
Their armor is more golden than the others.
You assume this is the "son" the Mayor was talking about.
Evil
Jake
"Hey, name's Jake, and don't bother with us."
"We refuse to leave the Dragon King."
"...and yes, I know what you're thinking."
"But your Mayor? There are things about him..."
Jake's voice is relatively high-pitched for a male Minotaur.
However, it wasn't completely out of the normal range.
It seems to you he's practiced it quite a bit.
Ocassionally he'd slip up into a much higher tone.
Evil
Jake
"Your Mayor is a monster, and I mean it."
"He's the enemy, not the Dragon King."
"I'm sure you've noticed SOMETHING is off..."
"Having done so many errands for him, that is."
You admit that the Mayor seems quite racist.
He also does have outbursts when he hears bad news.
You then mention the exchange with Polly and the Mayor.
When you tell Jake the Mayor's response, he nods.
Evil
Jake
"Yes, people. But think of this:"
"What does your Mayor think is a 'person'?"
"I will let you think on that for a second."
"I need to check with my dad on something."
A chill runs up your spine as you think on Jake's statement.
You always saw "people" as a very defined word.
But what if the Mayor only thinks of his own kind as such?
You realize you still have the steak in your bag...
Your choices are clear: Show the steak as a sign of war...
Or support the other races and try to make peace.
You know it will be very difficult to convince the Mayor.
It may be just as difficult to convince the Dragon.
You know both sides have some merit in their struggles.
From what the Mayor says, the village was attacked first.
However, that may be because of how they treated others.
The various races are all second-class citizens in the town.
What is your choice, brave warrior?
Try to make peace...
Or declare war?
(This option will affect the story from here out)
Make Peace
Declare War
Make Peace
Jake returns and you ready yourself to give your statement.
You notice his belt has a golden seal attached to it now.
Rerouting your gaze to match his, you tell him of your plan.
He nods slowly, processing your words.
Evil
Jake
"We have your word that you only want peace?"
"The Dragon King will go unharmed?"
"Very well, we accept these terms."
"Even though the Mayor will live for now..."
Evil
Jake
"I have no doubt he won't live for long."
"I won't explain further, as you must hurry."
"When peace has been made..."
"You should ask the Dragon King about it."
He hands you the seal.
You notice it seems to have been broken into 2 pieces.
They somehow manage to stay together despite that.
On the seal is a dragon symbol. You now know what to do.
You should return to the Mayor at once.
And... you should get rid of that now-rotting steak, too.
Declare War
You take out the now-rancid steak and throw it at Jake.
It hits his helmet with a disgusting squelch and slides off.
He slowly wipes off the grime and takes out his greatsword.
You ready your weapon as well.
Evil
Jake
"I see what you are now..."
"NOTHING BUT A PITIFUL SLAVE!"
"LISTEN TO THE MAYOR IF YOU PLEASE!"
"BUT KNOW THAT YOU MADE MANY ENEMIES TODAY!"
Jake runs off, accidentally dropping the seal.
You pick them up to use as proof of your betrayal.
Suddenly, a bell rings in the town.
You rush out before the army of Minotaurs attacks you.
Evil
Jake
So, we've come to this...
Very well, "hero."
May the best fighter win.
A large female Minotaur stands before you, dressed in gold.
You roll your eyes and prepare for an easy fight.
That's not what you get, of course.
The final Minotaur warriors falls at your feet.
Now, the finale: the mates of the Dragon King.
You get back on your horse and ride off toward the cave.
This won't be easy, but it will be necessary.
There are 2 hours left until the Blood Moon.
You might not make it!
Jake stood up for the Dragon King in spite of everything.
You barely know anything about him, though.
Maybe you could learn some things of him and his people...
So, you arrive at the Minotaur town and request an audience.
Evil
Jake
"Well, well, well, look who's back!"
"So, I was right, and you were wrong."
"Are you here to apologize?"
*Jake teases you with his tone*
You smile, and let out a very over-the-top apology.
Yes, you're TERRIBLY sorry, and you PROMISE to do better.
You wanted to see the best in people. What a HUGE mistake!
The two of you burst out laughing.
Evil
Jake
"Hah! I like your style, diplomat!"
"You really know how to lighten the mood."
"But then, of course, it begs the question:"
"Why do you want to talk to me?"
You explain that you love to learn about people.
Other races' cultures interest you, so you want to know...
Why are Minotaurs so close with Dragons? What's the history?
And you also want to hear about Jake himself.
Evil
Jake
"Hmm... Well, I can supply some knowledge."
"Minotaurs and Dragons are the oldest races."
"We once hunted them for sport and food."
"Then other races showed up, hunting us both."
Evil
Jake
"Humans were the final nail in the coffin."
"Versatile, intelligent, and cruel..."
"Able to find weakness and use it against us."
"Both our races nearly went extinct."
Evil
Jake
"So, we put our differences aside."
"It was originally a treatise of necessity."
"Over time, though, it became more. Respect."
"Minotaurs now ride Dragons into battle."
Evil
Jake
"However, the tides have turned on us now."
"Even with the races in relative peace..."
"Dragons are still going to go extinct."
"I wish someone like you had come sooner..."
Dragons? Going extinct? But... the war is over.
Everyone is safe from the Mayor. Why...? Then it hits you.
The King is inbred, and the only surviving male.
No matter how many mates he has, he'd never reproduce.
Evil
Jake
"Exactly. Kings and Queens are all inbreds."
"When one line can no longer reproduce..."
"Another should be there to take its place."
"No other males, no other births."
Your stomach churns. Couldn't something be done?
This peace treaty should've saved EVERYONE!
Why was this happening? Why couldn't you save everyone?
A real hero would know how to save the Dragons...
Evil
Jake
"A REAL hero? What do you even mean by that?"
"Most people dubbed 'heroes' slaughter us."
"They kill or maim everyone who is an issue."
"You were the first human to show us empathy!"
Evil
Jake
"Diplomat... you ARE a real hero..."
"More real than any 'hero' I've ever seen."
"Don't put yourself down like that."
"Those feelings you have right now?"
Evil
Jake
"...Those feelings of wanting to help?"
"Wishing you could save more than you have?"
"Wishing you could do something?"
"...That shows you to be a good person."
Evil
Jake
"So stop insulting my favorite human!"
"C'mon, let's grab a drink and forget this."
"It'll be my treat, OK?"
*He takes your hand and leads you to the pub*
You spend a good portion of the evening there.
Jake makes sure you don't get too drunk to ride.
At the end of the night, you're a little tipsy...
But you make it home safely.
You return to the town, still wondering about Jake.
You now know he is caring and lighthearted...
But what is his story? And what are his dreams?
You find Jake standing outside the pub, slightly drunk.
Evil
Jake
"Hey, hey, hey! It's you again!"
*He raises his mug* "I bet you must like me!"
*He downs his drink* "Woo! That hits the spot!"
"Sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo"
Evil
Jake
"Whaaaatttt can I do for yoooouuuuuzzzzz?"
*He notices your distaste."
"Alright, alright, come here little bugger."
*He takes your hand and goes into an alley*
Evil
Jake
*Whispering, he leans in to tell you:*
"I'm not actually drunk, OK? It's a ploy"
"I got hit on by some ladies in there."
"It weirded me out, OK?"
Evil
Jake
"...So I started acting drunk so they'd leave."
"I was trying to get away when you got to me."
Evil
Jake
"Just... don't tell anyone, though."
"It'll make me look bad in front of the guys."
"They don't really get the whole... well..."
"The fact that men can be harrassed, too."
You nod. Humans were the exact same way.
Many men thought it was an honor to be hit on unwarrented.
...That is, until it happens to them. Jake looks relieved.
Apparently he wasn't expecting you to get it.
Evil
Jake
"Thanks for having my back, dude."
"I gotta stagger home now. Have a good one!"
*Jake puts the drunk act back on*
*He stumbles away into the night*
This time, you find Jake hanging around the outer wall.
He seems to be deep in thought, and jumps when approached.
After regaining himself, he smiles, bowing dramatically.
You both start laughing, before he speaks:
Evil
Jake
"Hey dude, what's happenin'?"
"Let me guess... you're gonna ask questions."
"I can tell you're curious, it's all over you."
"Go ahead man, what do ya want to know?"
The first thing you ask is something that's bothered you:
Why does Jake always wear that armor and helmet?
It must get hot sometimes in there...
And you don't even know what he looks like.
Evil
Jake
"You dont know what I look like, eh?"
"THAT is exactly the point. I'm just armor."
"Because no one knows who I am..."
"I can go anywhere and do anything."
You process what he said for a second.
So, if he takes off the armor, no one recognizes him?
What happens if someone notices him leaving the same home?
Wouldn't they know THEN?
Evil
Jake
"Nope, because I've got dozens of sis-"
"Er, siblings that look nearly identical."
"I'm an octuplet, you see..."
"Sometimes, I fool even my own mom!"
You and Jake laugh. His mirth is so contagious!
You enjoy every second with this guy, and you notice...
Something inside you is stirring suddenly.
Your cheeks flush as you try to ignore it.
Evil
Jake
"Anyway, if you want..."
"I can show you one of my hangouts later."
"There's a spa down the road that I go to."
"I take all of my... er, partners, there."
Evil
Jake
"...Yeah, we'll go with that word. Partners."
*He shifts uncomfortably, suddenly a bit shy.*
*After a moment of silence, he claps.*
"Anyway, you got anything else to ask?"
You look at Jake, wondering what made him so shy just now.
He DID just basically invite you to be a... partner?
Did he mean what you think he meant? You shake your head.
It's late and the spa is likely closed now. Another time.
You arrive back at the Minotaur camp, but can't find Jake.
You ask one of the guards if he knows Jake's whereabouts.
The guard points toward the dock and tells you to try there.
Thankfully, you find Jake sitting near some palm trees.
Evil
Jake
*He hums to himself as he writes... something.*
*It appears he's working on a letter?*
*He notices you and puts his quill down.*
"Hey, dude! What's up, my little friend?"
Evil
Jake
"This? It's a memo. I want to run for Mayor!"
*He notices your look of confusion*
"Ohhhh right, you don't hold elections..."
"Well, if I do this right, THAT will change."
Evil
Jake
"I'm going to overthrow that jerk Mayor!"
"Yeah, you made an agreement and all..."
"But I still don't trust him!"
"So I'm going to convince the townsfolk..."
Evil
Jake
"..That inclusivity is the way to go."
"What better way to be inclusive than, well..."
"Have a Minotaur as Mayor for once? Eh?"
"Yeah, it's a longshot for sure."
Evil
Jake
"I think, maybe, with your help?"
"It'll at least get people thinking."
"Maybe I'M not the one to lead..."
"But I honestly just want equality."
You ask Jake what he needs from you. You've become close.
You won't turn your back on him.
Jake beams. At least, you think he does. It's hard to tell.
But there's no mistaking the little gleam in his eyes.
Evil
Jake
"So, all I need you to do is keep learning."
"About the Goblins, Orcs, Slimes, Harpies..."
"Even the Minotaurs and Dragons."
"Learn our ways, and keep being our diplomat."
Evil
Jake
"You're a hero to all, no matter the race."
"You can bridge that gap between our sides."
"Eventually, the people will hear your voice."
"They will come around, I promise you that."
Evil
Jake
"Anyway, I'm almost done with this memo."
"Do you... do you want to just sit and hang?"
"Or like, maybe go to the bar or something?"
"I know I've kinda blown you off a little..."
You tell Jake that you'd love to hang out a while.
The two of you sit on the beach until the Sun goes down.
...Then you head to the bar, to get tipsy.
What happened after closing? That's anyone's guess.
All we can assume is that it was a beautiful night.
You wake up next to Jake with a new appreciation for life.
After a kiss goodbye, you head home.
When you arrive at camp, you hear a loud argument.
It appears to be coming from within the largest house:
That's Jake's home! And from the sound of it...
He's arguing with a male Minotaur. Possibly his father?
You slowly sneak your way around the house.
Peeking through the window, you see Jake's back to you.
You can't see the other Minotaur, but you can hear him.
You listen to the conversation...
Evil
Jake
"...Mayor's up to no good, and that 'monster?'"
"As YOU put it? Is the only one who gets it!"
"Sure, it's a human, but who cares!?"
"We NEED humans on our side to overthrow him!"
Unknown Minotaur
"ON OUR SIDE? Jacqueline, do you not remember the war?"
"How we were hunted to near-extinction BY HUMANS?"
"By the Gods, child, first you pull this... gender-thing..."
"And now you're sleeping with those animals!?"
Evil
Jake
"I'm not a child anymore, dad! If I was...
"I wouldn't command our army, now would I?"
"Or are you going to tell me you put a KID..."
"In charge of our safety!? Show some respect!"
Jake's Dad
"I USED to respect you, Jacqueline."
"Now? You're too caught up in these... trends."
"You're a gender-bending, human-loving who-"
Evil
Jake
"Say one more thing and see what happens!"
"The army is at my beck and call, dad..."
"I WAS going to let Tyler take after you..."
"But if I must, I WILL start a coup."
Jake's Dad
"Why in the WORLD would you have that human-lover TYLER..."
"In charge of the throne? Just because he agrees with you?"
"He's an idiot! He thinks humans are inherently GOOD!"
"Which, we ALL know, is a bold-faced LIE!"
Evil
Jake
"It's no lie, dad. They may have screwed up..."
"But they've made peace with us."
"YOU signed the treaty yourself!"
"This is a time of free love and prosperity."
Jake's Dad
"Love? For monsters? HAH! The treaty was a last resort."
"Peace, love, and prosperity are words with no meaning."
"Fairy-tales we tell children to calm their nerves."
"You may be grown, but you're still a child, Jacqueline."
Evil
Jake
"THAT'S NOT MY NAME, DAD!"
"YOU WILL RESPECT ME FOR WHO I AM!"
"MY COMRADES DO, AND THEY WILL FIGHT FOR ME!"
"THEY HAVE HAD MY BACK MORE THAN YOU EVER DID!"
Jake storms off, and you sneak away from the window.
You hear the front door open and slam shut.
Jake is standing on the porch, trying to hold back tears.
It's clearly not working as you hear muffled sobs.
Evil
Jake
*Jake sees your face and speaks*
"You know my birth name now, I guess."
"The whole town does, now."
"I need something from you, please..."
You grab his hand and squeeze it tightly.
He crouches down, taking off his helmet...
He buries his face in your chest and cries.
You hold your lover close as you console him.
After some time, Jake recovers. He puts his helmet back on.
You ask if he wants to go to the spa he mentioned before.
He nods, eyes still drying from the tears.
He takes you to a hot spring right outside town...
You near the town to find an all-out war going on:
Minotaurs in black fighting Minotaurs in gold.
The coup has started, and Jake might need your help.
You enter the fray to look for him.
You rush to Jake's house to find it completely boarded up.
You hear Jake's voice from within, and run around the side.
...The window you had looked in from isn't boarded.
Using your foot, you smash through the window.
Jake's voice sounds muffled, like he's gagged.
You sneak your way down the hall to his room.
Jake is tied to a chair and gagged. Your face goes white.
He looks at you with pleading eyes.
Before you can untie him, though, you hear a voice cry out.
Jake's Dad
"SOMEONE GOT IN THROUGH THE WINDOW! FIND THEM!"
"LOOK IN JACQUELINE'S ROOM FIRST! IT MIGHT BE THE HUMAN!"
You turn to Jake, who's eyes shift toward the closet.
You hide, trying to calm your racing heart as you breathe.
The calmer you are, the better you keep quiet...
You hear a sneering voice outside your walls:
Unknown Minotaur
"Awww, your human friend is here to save you!"
"Too bad he can't, Jacky-poo..."
"I'm going to enjoy our marriage when this is over..."
*You hear footsteps and Jake's snarl as they get closer*
On instinct you kick the closet doors open.
You then jump on the black-clad Minotaur, swinging wildly.
You grab his helmet and lift it off of him.
He pushes you away and runs out of the room.
You quickly untie Jake, and then hear a crash.
The mob of gold-clad Minotaurs had broken through the doors.
Soon, a pair of them had found the two of you.
You tell them to get Jake to safety. They escort him out.
You follow behind, knowing that this is not your fight.
You just want to make sure Jake is OK before leaving.
The four of you head back to the barracks.
A few Minotaurs are still asleep somehow.
One of the lower bunks is cleared to make room for Jake.
They lower him down, salute the two of you, and leave.
You assume they're going back to the warfront.
You kneel beside Jake, holding his hand.
Evil
Jake
"Thanks, man. You saved me from..."
*He shivers* "...A horrible fate."
"My dad believes in arranged marriages."
"The guy that ran off? He was my cousin."
A chill goes up your spine.
You hadn't even realized the gravity of what you were doing.
You hold Jake's hand to your chest. He closes his eyes.
The two of you sit and breathe for a while.
Evil
Jake
"...I'm not ready to commit to anything yet..."
"But I'll tell you one thing, diplomat:"
"You saved my life, and earned my heart."
"No one else can say that."
You close your eyes, smiling. You tell Jake it's mutual.
When you open them, you realize you had fallen asleep.
Your head was on Jake's chest, still holding hands.
The sounds of battle are over. You pack up and leave.
Evil
Jake
"Hey, dude. Can we talk a second?"
"...I know you've been seeing other people."
"I told you I'm not ready for commitment..."
"So I really don't mind. Just keep in touch."
Evil
Jake
"Hey, dude. Can we talk a second?"
"...I know you've been seeing other people."
"I told you I'm not ready for commitment..."
"So I really don't mind. Just keep in touch."
Evil
Jake
"Hey, dude. Can we talk a second?"
"...I know you've been seeing other people."
"I told you I'm not ready for commitment..."
"So I really don't mind. Just keep in touch."
Evil
Jake
"Hey, dude. Can we talk a second?"
"...I know you've been seeing other people."
"I told you I'm not ready for commitment..."
"So I really don't mind. Just keep in touch."
Evil
Jake
"Hey, dude. Can we talk a second?"
"...I know you want to see other people."
"I told you I'm not ready for commitment..."
"So I really don't mind. Just keep in touch."
